content.description: Fun slab past one bolt near the crux at around 15' then lower angle terrain with horizontals for gear. Kinda funky and runout, but cool position.
content.protection: 1 x bolt + assorted smaller cams for horizontals. 160' rap.
content.location: In the notch between West Cottage and DAFF dome, in the Wind Tunnel area.

content.description: Cool golden knobs and cracks for pro. A fun and mellow route in an awesome setting.
content.protection: 5 x bolts + a handful of finger and hand sized cams. 130' rap, or traverse right to other anchors for single 60 meter rope rap.
content.location: In the notch between West Cottage and DAFF dome, in the Wind Tunnel area.

content.description: Follow the low angle slab past a bolt (~35' up) to a headwall.  Climb up past another bolt to lower angle slab and horizontal cracks above. The route shares an anchor with String Cheese.
content.protection:
2 bolts, small cams to 1"

chain anchor

- a single 70m rope is sufficient (but tight) for rappel/TR, recommend knots and paying attention

- the 'R' rating is really meant for the section to the first bolt (which is easy climbing)

- protection is sightly trickier than some of the other routes next door
Small cams in horizontal breaks plus bolts
content.location: There are several bolted lines on the slabby side of West Cottage Dome.  This is the second from the right.  Lower off or abseil.

content.description: Fun, low angle slab and knob climbing past a bolt about half way up the route.  There is some pro at the start of the route, but nothing worth while after the bolt.  A fall from there could be serious (unless your belayer is a fast runner).  That said, the climbing is low key.
content.location: This is the low angle route opposite 'Eddie Muenster' in the Wind Tunnel (i.e. on the North side of DAFF dome or skier's left when entering the Wind Tunnel from the top).

content.description: An easy climb up the right side of West Cottage Dome, Cheesecake takes a golden slab past a single bolt to a series of thin horizontal cracks. The crux is just after the bolt.
content.protection:
1 draw, cams from 1/4" to 1.5"

There are 2 bolted chains at the top - can TR and rap with a 60 m rope
content.location: Right-most route on the West Cottage Dome side of the Wind Tunnel. Just right of Eddie Muenster.
